page.title: 19Communications / Media.
page.content:
Almost all the households in the Burncross area have a{telephone}and a third also have an extension telephone. Most families possess at least one{transistor radio}and three quarters of the sample said that they regularly listened to the radio. The most popular channels were the local, independent station{Radio Hallam,}and national{Radio 1.}Very few listened to Radios 3 and 4 or the local BBC station.
There was not a single household in the sample who did not possess a {television.}Most have a colour T.V. and many families have a second set. The average length of time that adults and children watch T.V. each day was given as{2-4 hours.}Most families take at least one{newspaper}regularly.
